snippet: While some Taliban factions have banned vaccinations since 2012, fleeing refugees often encounter vaccinators.
abstract: Clashes with Taliban militants in Pakistan, which have displaced nearly a million people, have both harmed and helped effort to eradicate polio in country; number of cases has increased during crisis, but refugees fleeing Taliban areas where vaccinations have been banned are encountering medical workers along the way who have administered some two million doses so far.
lead_paragraph: While some Taliban factions have banned vaccinations since 2012, fleeing refugees often encounter vaccinators.

headline.print_headline: How Fighting in Pakistan Affects War Against Polio
headline.main: How Fighting in Pakistan Affects War Against Polio
